result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanna E Deffibaugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular, effective November 3, 2016
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year, New Discharge Date 10/21/17

1:06 pm
 Defendant Shanna E Deffibaugh in court. Agent Todd Mueller in court.
Court finds the Defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.
Court informs the Defendant that, if not paid, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.
Court instructs the Defendant regarding right to and how to obtain counsel.
Court adjourned at 1:08 pm
Probation review hearing on September 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant contacted office requesting to reschedule Probation Review Hearing.  Hearing rescheduled to September 15, 2016, at 1 pm.  Warrant stayed.

1:35 pm
No appearance by Defendant.  Agent Todd Mueller in court.
Court orders Warrant.
Court adjourned at 1:35 pm.
Notice of Hearing mailed to Defendant has been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Not Deliverable as Addressed.  Unable to Forward.
Probation review hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Battery and count 2 to Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct, and will dismiss and read-in 2015CF38.  ADA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 and 2 as amended.  Court orders 2015CF38 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

Count 1 & Count 2 
SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months concurrent to each other

CONDITIONS: (EACH)

Count 1 - 20 days county jail - stayed and to be used at the discretion of the probation agent for disciplinary purposes.
Court costs
AODA & any follow-up
No violent contact with anyone in the defendant's household.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court adjourned at 10:46 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-21-2015 10:00 am

3:52 p.m.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Atty Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests to get reports and will resolve together.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on April 21, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:53 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

10:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have received the victim impact statement and requests more time.  Court will set for another hearing - Plea & Sentencing on March 30, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:14 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

10:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and needs additional time.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on February 17, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:14 a.m.

2:40 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Statement by Attorney Privat - requests additional time - has received an offer.

Court directs case be set for Plea/Sentencing and to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 2:41 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 25, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

2:03 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant is currently in a class and will be done the middle of November.  Court will set for plea & sentencing the end of November.

Court adjourned at 2:04 p.m.
State's
Return date on October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:46 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat indicates there will be a waiver of the preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of her right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 1:48 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

2:38 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barbara Privat present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Privat.

Court directs Preliminary Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 2:39 p.m.
Defendant's Discovery Demand
Defendant's Motion for Discovery
Status hearing on July 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
By Atty Barbara Privat

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:09 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.   Special Prosecutor Chuck Stertz for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Special Prosecutor makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing in approx 30 days.

Court adjourned at 9:10 a.m.
